title: MegaRAC SP-X
description_page_designprob: Very long description here that may not fit into the page and may cause design problems
run_firmware_update: Run Firmware Update for Management Controller
sync_desc: On/Off to Sync with latest Sensor and EventLog updates.
admin_desc: The User profile can be viewed.
logout_confirm_msg: Would you like to Sign out of this Session? If yes, click Ok else click Cancel.
bios_desc: Open the new window or popup to configure the BIOS Settings.
name: Name
creator: Creator
script_help:
This page displays the list of available Scripts.
Click on Icon to upload script file.
Click on Icon to edit the selected script in a popup window.
In the popup window,
  • Click on Test Run button to run the script.
  • Click on Save changes button to Save the Script.
Click on Icon to delete the selected script.
Enter a script name into the Search field to find a specific file.
NOTE: File name must be alpha-numeric but the following special characters are allowed: ' '(space), '-'(hyphen), '_'(underscore).
script_delete: Deletion of script not allowed since it is already part of existing scheduled Task.Do perform this action in Task updation.
scripts_no_rows: There are no Scripts information present at this time.
video_notsupport: Your browser does not support playing this video
video_rigths: You need to have either Administrator or Operator privilege to perform this action.
kvm_disabled:
The user does not have the privilege to launch KVM Session.
Please try again from a privileged user account.
invalid_filesize: Invalid Video Log Filesize. Cannot Play or Download 0 KB File.
focus_lost: Navigated to another Tab. Kindly relaunch video player application
eventlog_hlp:
• This page displays the list of events incurred by the different sensors on this device. Click on a record to see the details of that entry.
  • With your cursor, hover over the graph to view the number of events by date.
  • You can use the date range, sensor type, or sensor name filter options to view those specific events.
  • Click Clear Event Logs option to delete all existing records for all sensors.
  • Click Download Event Logs option to download the logs in a text file format.
terminal_mode_events: Terminal Mode Remote Console software Events
cancel_update: Are you sure to abort the firmware update process. The device will be reset to go to normal operating mode
flashing_refresh_warning: Firmware upgrade is in process. Refreshing this page will interrupt this process and will likely cause the BMC to not work as it should, so it is highly recommended that you do not continue with the refresh.
closing_request: Step (1 of 6): Closing all active client requests
preparing_device: Step (2 of 6): Preparing device for firmware upgrade
select_section: Click on the Section to select it
selection_alert: Please select one section to proceed with Firmware Update
syncdatetime: Sync date and time with Server
server_name: Name should be Alpha Numeric without spaces, should not start with a number, Min 4 and Max 15 characters supported
server_pass: Password should contain (Min 4 and Max 64) characters, without spaces
server_ip: IP Address (Ex: 10.0.0.4, Max range : 255.255.255.254), should not start with '0'
file_size: Enter the size of the file in bytes (size ranges from 3 to 65535)
rotate_count: Enter the rotate count value (ranges from 0 to 255)
non_sec_port: Non Secure Port should be between 1 and 65535 (only numbers supported)
sec_port: Secure Port should be between 1 and 65535 (only numbers supported)
timeout: Timeout should be between 60 and 36000 (only numbers supported)
max_sessions: Available Sessions should not be less than 0 (only numbers supported)
curr_sessions: Active Sessions should not be less than 0 (only numbers supported)
date_entry: Date selected should be less than JAN 19, 2038
hr_entry: The field supports only numeric values between 0 to 23 for Hour
min_entry: The field supports only numeric values between 0 to 59 for Minutes
sec_entry: The field supports only numeric values between 0 to 59 for Seconds
ntp_server_entry: The field supports Server IP Address with iPv4(EX: 10.0.0.1) or iPv6 specification(EX: 2002:c001:109:b:211:22ff:fe87:6745)
ipv4_subnet: Subnet Mask Address (Ex: 10.0.0.4, Max range : 255.255.255.254), should not start with '0'
ipv4_default: Default Gateway Address (Ex: 10.0.0.4, Max range : 255.255.255.255), should not start with '0'
ipv6_addr: Specify a static IPv6 address to be configured for the selected interface
ipv6_subnet: Subnet Prefix Length value ranges from 0 to 128.
ipv6_default: Specify the v6 Default Gateway for IPv6 settings
vlan_id: VLAN ID value ranges from 1 to 4094. VLAN ID 0, 4095 are reserved
vlan_priority: VLAN Priority value ranges from 1 to 7
user_name: User Name should be Alpha Numeric without spaces, should not start with a number, Max 16 characters supported
ldap_ip: IP Address (Ex: 10.0.0.4, Max range : 255.255.255.254), should not start with '0'. Supports IPV4 and IPV6 formats
ldap_port:
Port should be between 1 and 65535 (only numbers supported). Default Port is 389. Default Port(Secure Connection) is 636.
NOTE: Port 80 is blocked for TCP/UDP protocols.
ldap_bind_dn: Bind DN is a string of 4 to 64 alpha-numeric characters. Should not start with a number. Ex: cn=manager,ou=login, dc=domain,dc=com
ldap_pass: Password should contain (Min 1 and Max 48) characters, without spaces
ldap_search_base: Search Base is a string of 4 to 64 alpha-numeric characters. Should not start with a number. Ex: ou=login, dc=domain,dc=com
active_dir_domain_name: Specify the Domain Name for the User. e.g. MyDomain.com
active_dir_secret_user: User Name is a string of 1 to 64 alpha-numeric characters, it must start with an alphabet and should not contain special characters like ',/.:()|=+<>?& $#'
active_dir_secret_password: Password must be at least 6 character long without white spaces
active_dir_ip: Server IP Address (Ex: 10.0.0.4, Max range : 255.255.255.254), should not start with '0'. Supports IPV4 and IPV6 formats. IP address of 3 servers should not be the same
active_group_name: User Name should be Alpha Numeric without spaces, should not start with a number, Max 64 characters supported
ldap_group_name: User Name should be Alpha Numeric without spaces, should not start with a number, Max 255 characters supported
active_group_domain: Role Group Domain name should be Alpha Numeric without spaces, should not start with a number, Max 255 characters supported. Ex: megatrends.com
ldap_group_search_base: Role Group Search Base name should be Alpha Numeric without spaces, should not start with a number, Max 255 characters supported. Ex: dc=domain
user_password: User Password should not be empty, it can contain password of length either upto 16 bytes or 20 bytes length based on the settings choosen
remote_server_pass: Password should contain (Min 1 and Max 32) characters, without spaces
remote_server_path: Source path to store video (Ex: '\home\share'). Special characters like '<', '>', ':', '*', '|', '.', '?' are not allowed
firmware_source_path: Enter full source path (including image filename) to its location on server
server_retry_count: Number of times to retry when firmware transfer fails. Range from 1 to 15

ad_users_add_limitaion: Number of Active Directory Users configured to the Server has been limited to 5 numbers

s1_sleeping_with_system_hw_processor_con: S1 'Sleeping With System HW & Processor Context Maintained'

sleeping_in_s1_s2_or_s3: Sleeping in S1, S2, or S3
platform_generated_snmp_trap_oem_format: Platform Generated SNMP Trap, OEM Format

maximum_sessions_in_use: Maximum number of sessions already in use
pw_reset_confirm: Click OK if you want to continue resetting the user's password.
pw_otp_success: OTP has been sent to the configured Email. Note: OTP will get expired in five minutes.
pw_reset_success: Password has been changed successfully.Please relogin with the new password
pw_reset_smtp_disabled: SMTP Server is disabled for this channel
pw_reset_smtp_fail_1: The Authentication type is not supported by SMTP Server
pw_reset_smtp_fail_3: Unable to connect to SMTP Server
pw_reset_email_fail_2: Email ID is not configured for the User
pw_reset_fail: Unable to reset the Password for the User. Please try again later

pw_reset_fail_email: Unable to send newly generated password to the configured email ID
invalid_or_unsupported_firmware_or_softw: Invalid or Unsupported Firmware / Software Version
firmware_or_software_change_detected_was: Firmware / Software Change Detected was successful
